chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.


Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
a: R
x: Rbar

Goal:
Lim (fun _ : R => a) x = a

Premises:
*** [ R : Set ]
Lim = fun (f : R -> R) (x : Rbar) => Lim_seq (fun n : nat => f (Rbar_loc_seq x n)) : (R -> R) -> Rbar -> Rbar Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
is_lim_seq_const : forall a : R, is_lim_seq (fun _ : nat => a) a
is_LimSup_seq_const : forall a : R, is_LimSup_seq (fun _ : nat => a) a
is_LimInf_seq_const : forall a : R, is_LimInf_seq (fun _ : nat => a) a
LimSup_seq_const : forall a : R, LimSup_seq (fun _ : nat => a) = a
LimInf_seq_const : forall a : R, LimInf_seq (fun _ : nat => a) = a
Lim_seq_const : forall a : R, Lim_seq (fun _ : nat => a) = a
Lim_comp : forall (f g : R -> R) (x : Rbar), ex_lim f (Lim g x) -> ex_lim g x -> Rbar_locally' x (fun y : R => g y <> Lim g x) -> Lim (fun x0 : R => f (g x0)) x = Lim f (Lim g x)
Lim_id : forall x : Rbar, Lim (fun y : R => y) x = x
Lim_ext_loc : forall (f g : R -> R) (x : Rbar), Rbar_locally' x (fun y : R => f y = g y) -> Lim g x = Lim f x
ex_lim_comp : forall (f g : R -> R) (x : Rbar), ex_lim f (Lim g x) -> ex_lim g x -> Rbar_locally' x (fun y : R => g y <> Lim g x) -> ex_lim (fun x0 : R => f (g x0)) x
Lim_seq_scal_r : forall (u : nat -> R) (a : R), Lim_seq (fun n : nat => u n * a) = Rbar_mult (Lim_seq u) a
Lim_ext : forall (f g : R -> R) (x : Rbar), (forall y : R, f y = g y) -> Lim g x = Lim f x
real = fun x : Rbar => match x with | Finite x0 => x0 | _ => 0 end : Rbar -> R real is a coercion
filterlim_Rbar_mult_l : forall (a : R) (l : Rbar), filterlim (Rmult a) (Rbar_locally l) (Rbar_locally (Rbar_mult a l))
is_lim_unique : forall (f : R -> R) (x l : Rbar), is_lim f x l -> Lim f x = l
filterlim_const : forall a0 : ?U, filterlim (fun _ : ?T => a0) ?F (locally a0) where ?T : [a : R x : Rbar |- Type] ?U : [a : R x : Rbar |- UniformSpace] ?F : [a : R x : Rbar |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [a : R x : Rbar |- Filter ?F]
Sup_seq_scal_l : forall (a : R) (u : nat -> Rbar), 0 <= a -> Sup_seq (fun n : nat => Rbar_mult a (u n)) = Rbar_mult a (Sup_seq u)
Inf_seq_scal_l : forall (a : R) (u : nat -> Rbar), 0 <= a -> Inf_seq (fun n : nat => Rbar_mult a (u n)) = Rbar_mult a (Inf_seq u)
Lim_seq_scal_l : forall (u : nat -> R) (a : R), Lim_seq (fun n : nat => a * u n) = Rbar_mult a (Lim_seq u)
is_lim_id : forall x : Rbar, is_lim (fun y : R => y) x x
is_LimInf_seq_scal_pos : forall (a : R) (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), 0 < a -> is_LimInf_seq u l -> is_LimInf_seq (fun n : nat => a * u n) (Rbar_mult a l)
is_LimSup_seq_scal_pos : forall (a : R) (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), 0 < a -> is_LimSup_seq u l -> is_LimSup_seq (fun n : nat => a * u n) (Rbar_mult a l)
eventually_filter = {| filter_ex := fun (P : nat -> Prop) (H0 : eventually P) => match H0 with | @ex_intro _ _ N H => ex_intro (fun x : nat => P x) N (H N (Nat.le_refl N)) end; filter_filter := {| filter_true := ex_intro (fun N : nat => forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> True) 0%nat (fun (n : nat) (_ : (0 <= n)%nat) => I); filter_and := fun (P Q : nat -> Prop) (H : eventually P) => match H with | @ex_intro _ _ NP HP => fun H0 : eventually Q => match H0 with | @ex_intro _ _ NQ HQ => ex_intro (fun N : nat => forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> P n /\ Q n) (Init.Nat.max NP NQ) (fun (n : nat) (Hn : (Init.Nat.max NP NQ <= n)%nat)...
is_lim_comp : forall (f g : R -> R) (x k l : Rbar), is_lim f l k -> is_lim g x l -> Rbar_locally' x (fun y : R => g y <> l) -> is_lim (fun x0 : R => f (g x0)) x k
is_lim_comp' : forall (f : ?T -> R) (g : R -> R) (x0 l : Rbar), filterlim f ?F (Rbar_locally x0) -> is_lim g x0 l -> ?F (fun y : ?T => f y <> x0) -> filterlim (fun y : ?T => g (f y)) ?F (Rbar_locally l) where ?T : [a : R x : Rbar |- Type] ?F : [a : R x : Rbar |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [a : R x : Rbar |- Filter ?F]
Lub.Rbar_ub_Finite : forall (E : Rbar -> Prop) (l : R), Lub.Rbar_is_upper_bound E l -> is_upper_bound (fun x : R => E x) l
filterlim_Rbar_mult : forall x y z : Rbar, is_Rbar_mult x y z -> filterlim (fun z0 : R * R => fst z0 * snd z0) (filter_prod (Rbar_locally x) (Rbar_locally y)) (Rbar_locally z)
filter_and : forall P Q : ?T -> Prop, ?F P -> ?F Q -> ?F (fun x : ?T => P x /\ Q x) where ?T : [a : R x : Rbar |- Type] ?F : [a : R x : Rbar |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?Filter : [a : R x : Rbar |- Filter ?F]
filterlim_comp_2 : forall (f : ?T -> ?U) (g : ?T -> ?V) (h : ?U -> ?V -> ?W), filterlim f ?F ?G -> filterlim g ?F ?H -> filterlim (fun x0 : ?U * ?V => h (fst x0) (snd x0)) (filter_prod ?G ?H) ?I -> filterlim (fun x : ?T => h (f x) (g x)) ?F ?I where ?T : [a : R x : Rbar |- Type] ?U : [a : R x : Rbar |- Type] ?V : [a : R x : Rbar |- Type] ?W : [a : R x : Rbar |- Type] ?F : [a : R x : Rbar |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?G : [a : R x : Rbar |- (?U -> Prop) ->...-> Prop] ?FF : [a : R x : Rbar |- Filter ?F]
is_lim_comp_seq : forall (f : R -> R) (u : nat -> R) (x l : Rbar), is_lim f x l -> eventually (fun n : nat => u n <> x) -> is_lim_seq u x -> is_lim_seq (fun n : nat => f (u n)) l
